name: Entropy of the characters in a string
description:
In information theory, the [entropy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entropy_(information_theory)) of a random variable is the average level of "information", "surprise", or "uncertainty" inherent to the variable's possible outcomes. Given a discrete random variable `$X$`, which takes values in the set `$\mathcal{X}$` and is distributed according to `$p\colon \mathcal{X}\to[0, 1]$`, the entropy in base `$b$` is:
```math
\Eta = -\sum_{x \in \mathcal{X}} p(x) \log_b p(x),
```
where `$\Sigma$` denotes the sum over the variable's possible values.

### Task

Given a string, if I randomly pick one character from the string with equal probability, how many bits of randomness do I get?

Implement a function that calculates the base `$2$` entropy of the characters in the given string.

### Example

```
"Hello, world!" --> 3.180832987205441
```
